content: Bank Account Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 May 2019Can I change the default currency from SGD to MYR?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Xinyi Lum, Content Strategist at SeedlyLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 03 May 2019Hey! Are you asking with regards to the Seedly expense tracker? As we are a Singapore-centric budgeting app, the currency is in SGD. However! You have the flexibility of keying in transactions in MYR (amongst a list of many other currencies) and have it converted into SGD all within the app to best reflect the total balances :)Hope this helps!0 comments1

Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 03 May 2019You can open a multiple currency account like dbs multiplier account.https://www.dbs.com.sg/personal/deposits/savings-accounts/dbs-multi-currency-autosave?cid=sg:en:cbg:bsd:sem:goo:na:na:casa:cen_casa_sem:na:%2Bmulti+%2Bcurrency+%2Baccount&gclsrc=aw.ds&&gclid=CjwKCAjwqqrmBRAAEiwAdpDXtCm5hC2sSsvTseLoAy1kvpS3GOoAPUzbHgRsJegLUNidPCUGScpCXRoCTmYQAvD_BwE#Please up vote if the info is useful.0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 02 May 2019For bank accounts, you probably need to open a MYR bank account. Not sure if there are any available in Singapore though...0 comments0
